text: An election to Cork County Council took place on 11 June 2004 as part of that year's Irish local elections. 48 councillors were elected from ten electoral divisions by PR-STV voting for a five-year term of office. ==Results by party== {| class=wikitable ! colspan=2 align=center|Party ! valign=top|Seats ! valign=top|± ! valign=top|First Pref. votes ! valign=top|FPv% ! valign=top|±% |- | align=right|24 | align=right|+3 | align=right|61,025 | align=right|37.19% | align=right| |- | align=right|16 | align=right|-3 | align=right|54,030 | align=right|32.93% | align=right| |- | align=right|5 | align=right|+1 | align=right|16,729 | align=right|10.19% | align=right| |- | align=right|1 | align=right|+1 | align=right|10,079 | align=right|6.14% | align=right| |- | align=right|2 | align=right|-1 | align=right|13,059 | align=right|7.96% | align=right| |- | align=right|0 | align=right|-1 | align=right|2,174 | align=right|1.32% | align=right| |- | colspan=2 align=center|Totals | align=right |48 | align=center|- | align=right |164,093 | align=center|100% | align=center|— |} ==Results by Electoral Area== ===Bandon=== ===Bantry=== ===Blarney=== ===Carrigaline=== ===Fermoy=== ===Kanturk=== ===Macroom=== ===Mallow=== ===Midleton=== ===Skibbereen=== ==External links== * Official website Category:2004 Irish local elections 2004
title: 2004 Cork County Council election
